alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 10:12PM EDT until August 20 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR NORTHEASTERN BELL COUNTY... At 1012 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pineville, Kettle Island, Callaway, Rella, Miracle, Arjay, Stony Fork Junction, Blanche, Blackmont, Balkan, Cary and Straight Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Bird Branch, Puckett Creek, Brownies Creek, Stoney Fork, Cumberland River, Mill Creek, Newtown Branch, Tom Fork, Wieser Branch, Straight Creek, Left Fork Straight Creek, Ben Howard Branch, James York Branch, Sims Fork and Left Fork Caney Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
